description: Students explore a specified topic or theme in language, in literature, or in culture/civilization,
or in a combination of these, through close reading, discussion, analysis, and interpretation of
selected literary and/or non-literary works.  Sample topics include  "Madness and the Romantic
Dream," "Female Identity in Post-Colonial North Africa," and "Global Francophone Identities."
May be repeated if topics are different. Taught in French. Prerequisite: minimum of one 270-level
